District Three

Josh Borderud

Term Expires May 2026

  • Email ccouncil3@wacotx.gov
    • Josh Borderud has served on the Waco City Council since November 2020. He is the vice chair of the Heart of Texas Behavioral Health Network, the past chair of the Waco Metropolitan Planning Organization, and the past president of the Waco-McLennan County Bar Association.
On the Baylor Law School faculty, Josh supervises law students serving veterans, first responders, and children through clinical programs. For his work, he received the Sandra Day O’Connor Award for Professional Service at the Supreme Court of the United States from the American Inns of Court.

Josh began his career as an assistant district attorney in Milam County, prosecuting criminal cases and serving as legal adviser to the county judge. While in private practice in Waco, he was named the Outstanding Young Lawyer of McLennan County.

A triple alumnus of Baylor University, he is married to Jennifer Borderud, the director of the Armstrong Browning Library. They have two children.
